alert.note: Alert for Leon (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 2:16AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Leon County through 300 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Centerville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Centerville, Fort Boggy State Park, Jewett, Hilltop Lakes, Redland, Normangee, Leona, Pleasant Springs, Centerview, Robbins, Flynn and Eunice. This includes Interstate 45 between mile markers 152 and 171. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and will likely lead to ponding on Interstate 45 and minor flooding of other roads. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways!
